info.name: JWST API
info.description:
The James Webb Space Telescope API allows anyone to easily access the JWST data through an API. We keep the data updated frequently, as well as add new features.

You will need an API key which can be requested through our website at [jwstapi.com](https://jwstapi.com). If you have any issues, please use the contact form on that site.

request.description: Returns the current running version of the API.

Get all data from a given program ID. The list of program IDs can be found in the `ProgramList` route.

This is an authenticated route, `X-API-KEY` header must be present with your API key.

This route supports pagination. Pass in both the `page` and `perPage` params.

response.name: GetByProgramID

request.description:
Get all data by file type: jpg, ecsv, fits, json.

This is an authenticated route, X-API-KEY header must be present with your API key.

This route supports pagination. Pass in both the page and perPage params.

response.name: AllByFileType

request.description:
Get all data by suffix. The list of suffixes can be found through the `SuffixList` route.

This is an authenticated route, X-API-KEY header must be present with your API key.

This route supports pagination. Pass in both the page and perPage params.

Get all data from a given observation ID. The observation ID can be found in all object responses (from all by file type, all by suffix, etc). Please see example.

This is an authenticated route, `X-API-KEY` header must be present with your API key.

This route supports pagination. Pass in both the `page` and `perPage` params.

response.name: AllByObservationID

request.description:
List of all currently available programs.

This is an authenticated route, X-API-KEY header must be present with your API key.

List of all suffixes available for filtering.

This is an authenticated route, X-API-KEY header must be present with your API key.

response.name: SuffixList

request.description: Used to request an API key when signing up.
